abstract: Squatters have overtaken Las Vegas Valley houses abandoned in aftermath of housing collapse, in some cases bringing crime to formerly working-class and upscale neighborhoods; while some foreclosed homes are occupied by those needing shelter, authorities say others house chop shops, drug operations and counterfeiters; remaining residents express fears for their safety.

headline.print_headline: Squatters See New Nirvana in Las Vegas
headline.main: Squatters See a New Frontier in the Empty Homes of Las Vegas

snippet: Foreclosed homes still pockmark Las Vegas, lingering signs of the housing crisis. But they do not always stay empty: Squatters move in, bringing crime with them.
lead_paragraph: Foreclosed homes still pockmark Las Vegas, lingering signs of the housing crisis. But they do not always stay empty: Squatters move in, bringing crime with them.
